msItem.title: Akbar-namah. Vol. II. Part 2.
msItem.note: The flyleaf and first folio are stuck together Inside front cover, boldly written in Persian: KLY, presumably the Major Coley (?) whose name also occurs on Codrington/Reade No 112. The MS is uniform with No 112. Rubricated headings and punctuation.
msItem.incipit: Incipit, heading in red: Julus-i muqaddas-i hadrat-i shahinshahi

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather binding, as on No 112, the flyleaves of the same watermarked paper as used for the last two folios of that MS.

acquisition.p: Bequest from Major David Price received 5 March 1836.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org

list.item: History of India, Mughal period, Akbar.
